body.p:
To His Excellency
The Governor of Kentucky

Your Petitioner Isaac Rumsay states that he was this day fined $50, -- in the Lexington city court for carrying a pistol or rather he confessed Judgt for that amount, as he had in fact carried the pistol, He states that he believed owing to the state of the country & the apprehension growing out of it that he was justified in carrying a pistol. & so far as he knows others took the same view. He prays your Excellency to release him from so much of the fine as by law you can
He is unable to pay it, he is poor & has a wife to support by his trade as a wagonmaker. It is the first time he ever was arraigned or fined
Sworn to by Isaac Rumsey this 9th day of May 1861
The undersigned respictfully request your Excellency to remit the fine v Rumsy
